AD_FIELD.NAME: Author URL
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Widget Author URL
AD_FIELD.HELP: It is the widget author URL which will be shown in the widget about information box.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Can Maximize
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If the widget has the hability to maximize
AD_FIELD.HELP: When is true, the maximize button appears in the widget's header toolbar, next to the menu options

AD_FIELD.NAME: Widget Class
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifies a widget class definition
AD_FIELD.HELP: Identifies a widget class definition

AD_FIELD.NAME: Author Message
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Widget Author Message
AD_FIELD.HELP: It is a message the widget author can define. It will be shown in the widget about information.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Organization
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Organizational entity within client
AD_FIELD.HELP: An organization is a unit of your client or legal entity - examples are store, department. You can share data between organizations.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Widget Class Menu Item
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Unique identifier for the menu option
AD_FIELD.HELP: Unique identifier for the menu option

AD_FIELD.NAME: Is Separator
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Defines if a menu item is separator in the menu
AD_FIELD.HELP: Renders the menu option as separator, there no need for title nor action

AD_FIELD.NAME: Active
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A flag indicating whether this record is available for use or de-activated.
AD_FIELD.HELP: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reporting. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for auditing purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are existing invoices for it. By de-activating the Business Partner you prevent it from being used in future transactions.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Client
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Client for this installation.
AD_FIELD.HELP: A Client is a company or a legal entity. You cannot share data between Clients.

E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are existing invoices for it. By de-activating the Business Partner you prevent it from being used in future transactions.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Show Field Title
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Defines if the field label should be shown on top of the widget
AD_FIELD.HELP: This column defines if the a label with the field name should be shown on top of the widget like it is for other fields or if this label should be hidden and the extra space be used for the widget itself. Default is to show the title as for other fields.

AD_FIELD.HELP: An organization is a unit of your client or legal entity - examples are store, department. You can share data between organizations.

AD_FIELD.HELP: The Role determines security and access a user who has this Role will have in the System.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Help/Comment
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A comment that adds additional information to help users work with fields.
AD_FIELD.HELP: The Help field contains a hint, comment or help about the use of this item.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Translation
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An indication that an item is translated.
AD_FIELD.HELP: The Translated checkbox indicates if this column is translated.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Name
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A non-unique identifier for a record/document often used as a search tool.
AD_FIELD.HELP: A more descriptive identifier (that does need to be unique) of a record/document that is used as a default search option along with the search key (that is unique and mostly shorter). It is up to 60 characters in length.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Client
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Client for this installation.
AD_FIELD.HELP: A Client is a company or a legal entity. You cannot share data between Clients.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Application Element
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An element that consolidates help, descriptions and terms for a database column and allows for a central maintenance.
AD_FIELD.HELP: The System Element allows for the central maintenance of help, descriptions and terminology for a database column.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Module
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Module
AD_FIELD.HELP: Indicates the module the element forms part of.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Organization
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Organizational entity within client
AD_FIELD.HELP: An organization is a unit of your client or legal entity - examples are store, department. You can share data between organizations.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Reference
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The data type of this field.
AD_FIELD.HELP: The Reference indicates the type of reference field

AD_FIELD.NAME: Reference Search Key
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The exact reference specification for a list or a table.
AD_FIELD.HELP: The Reference Value indicates where the reference values are stored. It must be specified if the data type is Table or List.

AD_FIELD.NAME: DB Column Name
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of a column within the database.
AD_FIELD.HELP: The Column Name indicates the name of a column on a table as defined in the database.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Default Value
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The first non-null value in a set of values. It is used as a default value for a field when creating a record.
AD_FIELD.HELP: The defaults are evaluated in the order of definition, the first not null value becomes the default value of the column. The values are separated by comma or semicolon. a) Literals:. 'Text' or 123 b) Variables - in format @Variable@ - Login e.g. #Date, #AD_Org_ID, #AD_Client_ID - Accounting Schema: e.g. $C_AcctSchema_ID, $C_Calendar_ID - Global defaults: e.g. DateFormat - Window values (all Picks, CheckBoxes, RadioButtons, and DateDoc/DateAcct) c) SQL code with the tag: @SQL=SELECT something AS DefaultValue FROM ... The SQL statement can contain variables. There can be no other value other than the SQL statement. The default is only evaluated, if no user preference is defined. Default definitions are ignored for record columns as Key, Parent, Client as well as Buttons.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Description
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A space to write additional related information.
AD_FIELD.HELP: A description is limited to 255 characters.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Widget Class
AD_FIELD.HELP: Identifies a Widget Class definition

AD_FIELD.NAME: Length
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An indication of the column length as defined in the database.
AD_FIELD.HELP: The Length indicates the length of a column as defined in the database.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Help/Comment
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A comment that adds additional information to help users work with fields.
AD_FIELD.HELP: The Help field contains a hint, comment or help about the use of this item.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Active
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A flag indicating whether this record is available for use or de-activated.
AD_FIELD.HELP: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reporting. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for auditing purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are existing invoices for it. By de-activating the Business Partner you prevent it from being used in future transactions.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Central Maintenance
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A flag indicating that this label is managed in a central repository.
AD_FIELD.HELP: The Centrally Maintained checkbox indicates if the Name, Description and Help maintained in 'System Element' table or 'Window' table.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Fixed
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A means of locking the header tab so it will not be affected if a specified process is run again.
AD_FIELD.HELP: Is fixed

AD_FIELD.NAME: Mandatory
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An indication noting that completing in a field is required to proceed.
AD_FIELD.HELP: The Mandatory checkbox indicates if the field is required for a record to be save to the database.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Name
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A non-unique identifier for a record/document often used as a search tool.
AD_FIELD.HELP: A more descriptive identifier (that does need to be unique) of a record/document that is used as a default search option along with the search key (that is unique and mostly shorter). It is up to 60 characters in length.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Sequence Number
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The order of records in a specified document.
AD_FIELD.HELP: The Sequence indicates the order of records

AD_FIELD.NAME: Relative Priority
AD_FIELD.HELP: Defines the priority of the widgets if more than one instance have the same column and row. Lowest priority appears upper on the dashboard.

AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Title for the menu option
AD_FIELD.HELP: The label to show in the menu option

AD_FIELD.NAME: Superclass
AD_FIELD.HELP: A Superclass widget is an implementation that can be used by other widget classes so it is not necessary to develop the java class.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Widget Superclass
AD_FIELD.HELP: Identifies the Superclass widget used by this widget class.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Evaluate Fixed Value
AD_FIELD.HELP: When the flag is enabled the Fixed Value is evaluated as a JS expression.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Widget Class Menu Item
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Unique identifier for the menu option
AD_FIELD.HELP: Unique identifier for the menu option

AD_FIELD.NAME: Title
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The label to show in the menu option
AD_FIELD.HELP: The label to show in the menu option

AD_FIELD.NAME: Data Access Level
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates what type of data (in terms of AD_CLIENT and AD_ORG data columns) can be entered or viewed.
AD_FIELD.HELP:
Indicates what type of data (in terms of AD_CLIENT and AD_ORG data columns) can be entered or viewed. We can classify data in 4 major categories: - System (AD_CLIENT_ID=0, AD_ORG_ID=0) - system data (such as metadata for window, tab and field definition) - Organization (AD_CLIENT<>0, AD_ORG_ID<>0) - data particular to an organization (such as sales orders) - Client/Organization (AD_CLIENT<>0, AD_ORG_ID=anything) - data particular to an organization or shared among all organizations within one client - Client (AD_CLIENT<>0, AD_ORG_ID=0) - data that is specific to a client but can be used by all organizations within that client
or All (AD_CLIENT=anything, AD_ORG_ID=anything)

AD_FIELD.NAME: Inherited From
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Inherited From
AD_FIELD.HELP: The role from which a permission has been inherited. If a permission has this field set it means that this is an inherited permission, an therefore that the role owner of the permission is able to access it because it inherits from the role defined in this field.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Reference
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The data type of this field.
AD_FIELD.HELP: The Reference indicates the type of reference field

AD_FIELD.NAME: Sequence
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Defines the order on which the menu option needs to be shown
AD_FIELD.HELP: A number number used to sort the menu options

AD_FIELD.NAME: Widget Class
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifies a widget class definition
AD_FIELD.HELP: Identifies a widget class definition

AD_FIELD.NAME: Client
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Client for this installation.
AD_FIELD.HELP: A Client is a company or a legal entity. You cannot share data between Clients.

AD_FIELD.NAME: Action
AD_FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the method defined in the widget
AD_FIELD.HELP: Name of the method in the widget that need to be executed when clicking the menu item
